comment: He has an accent, and he is a little quiet. His class was hard, granted, it was Calculus 2. He is very caring and will pass you if you show up.

Caring and knowledgeable Professor. Has an accent and does go kind of fast, so come to class, pay attention, and don't zone out. Cal 2 is difficult, and he does make it very understandable. Quizzes and tests are based on the concept of the subject, but sometimes does drop like 1 question. Hw is it kind of easy just don't wait last min.

3/3 certain rules ie like the chain rule. The HW that is given is most of the time harder than what he'll give you on the test plus he is also flexible to some degree with the HW (will change the due date). You may have to teach yourself a little bit outside of class if you struggle with math but just follow the quizzes(the quizzes are open notes).

2/3 However some parts of the test have multiple parts and others just have one part. There is at most 2 bonus questions on the test that give you about 5-8 points back in case you miss another question. He will also help more than other math teachers on test day it may come from explaining a question in more depth or giving you the equations for

So Zhu Cao has an accent that is thick at first, but after about two to four classes, you start to understand him better. He teaches straight out of the MacMillan textbook but what he teaches is on his quizzes. And about 93% of his quizzes are identical copies of what is gonna be on the test. There are no set number of questions on the test 1/3

All this professor does in class is read the textbook, word for word. Little to no originality. Does not provide adequate online presence, support, or resources. He is nice, but not good at lecturing, he is very hard to follow. You will HAVE to read the textbook to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Professor Cao was great! I liked his model of two quizzes then a test. When I asked him what to study for the tests, he said the quizzes which i did & got an A on every test! He frequently talked about how he disliked more difficult and vague questions in the textbook and on the homework. Overall, really nice guy, cared about student's success

Professor Cao is fine as a professor except for the accent. For reference, parents are immigrants with strong accents. Despite this I still could not understand things he was saying. Test have bonuses but they add on to the curve? If you got a 100 but a classmate ended up getting the bonus your score would be curved down.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Don't take, he puts no effort in the class, no study guides and no notes given, you are better off teaching yourself. Everything he teaches is straight off of the textbook. If you try to ask him for extra material to help he'll just say go on the textbook, save your time and take someone that at least gives a study guide. Tests are also fairly hard
Dont take Math 2306 with him.

Overall a good professor and not too difficult to understand, I was not a good student in his class and attended very few lectures but was able to pull out an A. Quizzes are open book and a double-sided notes sheet is allowed on the final. Final replaces the lowest test, there are 3 tests besides final. Bi-Weekly hw for completion as well. Do it.
Easy class and easy professor. He is very knowledgeable about the topic. Lectures aren't too boring but you will need to go to most of them if you want to do well.

Homework is graded on completion. Quizzes are about whats on the homework and test are what was on the quizzes. Always give your quizzes and goes over them before the tests. Overall easy class if you come to class.

He grades quizzes and homework pretty generously. Tests are a different story. He's a good teacher, but I got screwed on tests when I put down the same concept answers as I did on the quizzes and homework. Why grade the answers as right in the first place if I can't get it right in tests?

I think your success in this class is dependent on how you learn and if you are decent at math or not. If you understand things from repetition and homework then you can easily get an A. The quizzes come directly from the homework and the tests come directly from the quizzes and homework. Also, make sure to complete the homework BEFORE the quizzes.

He knows his stuff well and I like the way he teaches, but I wish he would have used a schedule because we didn't even get to the last unit. Homework is very light and tests and quizzes are pretty similar to homework so they're easy too. Good class to take if you want an easy A and don't really care abt Linear Algebra.
he's not that great at teaching. he's hard to understand and he literally reads everything off of the textbook. 19 students in my class dropped out, that should say a lot.
Whatever you do, do not take this profesor . He's the worst professor I've had at KSU so far. He's not good at teaching at all. you're better of taking someone else.

DON'T DO IT, TAKE SOMEONE ELSE. He's not good at teaching at all. Tests are way harder than examples we did in class and the ones from the quizzes. He does not make sense when explaining the material in class, does not give feedbacks on tests, so if you go a problem wrong you have to figure it out yourself, and he does not respond to emails.
HARD to understand. Reads directly from textbook A LOT! Nice man. Entirely Reasonable in what he expects.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Cau is an incredibly nice man; however, he was not prepared or skilled enough for Enumerative Combinatorics. He admitted he failed it when in school, and by the end of class there were six textbooks being used. He will spend an entire class covering the same theorem with 10 ways to prove it. Rarely gives examples. No real structure.
easy class to pass. did not learn much because of his somewhat heavy accent.
He just copied from the textbook onto the board. He is not a tough grader and he gives plenty of bonus points.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Zhu cares about his students and knows the material. Sometimes his lecture style felt flawed. I passed the class because of the SI sessions. 3 tests, 1 final worth 2 tests, in-class open-book quizzes worth 1 test total. Ask questions and read the book. His accent is hard to understand at first but really isn't that bad. Also he gives partial credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He has a very thick accent and wasn't always the best at explaining things. Copy down EVERY example he does in class because he will put some of them on the quizzes which are open note. Class was extremely boring and I found it very difficult to pay attention for the hour and forty minutes. I'd recommend taking the class 3 days a week if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not a bad professor, seemingly easy grader, writes everything on the board, and usually does review of the previous class in the beginning of class. Talks a bit fast, but nothing crazy. Doesn't use D2L, emails out information. Tests similar to notes, open note quizzes. Pretty considerate guy.

Cons: Somewhat heavy accent, not too hard to understand though Pros: Solid teacher Optional HW, do the homework though Open note quizzes 3 tests and a final (most of the grade) Fair and straight forward grader. If you do the homework and go to SI sessions you will get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: The professor is extremely difficult to understand. He has a very thick accent & talks extremely fast. He does care about his students & really wants you to understand but he has no way of helping you because he cant understand your questions. I enjoyed the class but getting the grades to pass was very difficult since the grading wasn't clear.

This is the easiest professor you could possibly take for discrete math. He made things simple and was a very nice grader on quizzes and tests. I didnt use my textbook, but I went to the SI sessions which helped a lot. Without the sessions I wouldve got a B or C in his class, so although he is a nice grader, the material can be confusing so study
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is the best professor Ive taken, not even exaggerating. People who say they couldnt understand his accent also dont understand math because he puts everything on the board in great detail. He recognizes common mistakes people make in the course and shows examples of why these are mistakes so we dont do it before we make a bad habit

This professor is one of the best math teachers KSU has to offer. You do not need to do every homework or read over the book to do well, just pay attention, take notes and actively participate during class. Tests and quizzes are hard but he gives credit for the process not the right answer. He is not an easy teacher, but he is very good at his job.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: Quiet voice, be ready to write all your notes cause he does not use D2L or have powerpoints. Attendance is mandatory for notetaking. I passed because I went to every SI session. He emails us most if not all of his exam and quiz reviews which is very helpful so do it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very heavy accent but besides that he was a pretty good teacher. Quizzes are exactly like tests, he cares and gives credit if you try and get the question completely wrong. Would definitely take again.

His entire class is lectures, and your grade is only quizzes and tests.  That being said: if you take notes, you will pass the quizzes.  His quizzes are open book/note.  His tests are not, but they are just the quiz with 1-2 numbers changed.  The material is hard, and the class is fast paced.  He has a thick accent, but writes down everything.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He explains things very well and is open to questions about notes and homework, even while in class. Yes, he has a heavy accent, but you get used to it within a week or so. His tests are exactly like the quizzes, homework problems, and examples worked out in class and from the textbook. You will have to work to earn an A.

I first took him for calc II and have taken him for every math class since then. He doesn't complicate things, all he cares about is you understanding the concept, and usually doesn't mix material from past classes with current (ex. integration by parts in a differential equation). I've never understood the material more than in his classes.

Really good teacher. Had him for Calculus II and did a great job of explaining and if you needed help he had very flexible office hours. Super nice guy who is also very passionate about math. I would definitely recommend and would take him again.
Great professor! Definitely recommend

He is a good professor. Tests and quizzes difficult but they are close to hm problems. Class moves fast. Final covered everything very long. My only complaint is the lecture got way ahead of the quizzes and homework. He is two sections ahead of what you are about to be tested on.

This class is not a cake walk. Sure the quizzes are open book open note but if your a slacker, DO NOT TAKE HIM. His test are hard. Youtube and Wolframaplha will be your best friend in this class. He's a cool guy out of class, but in class, be sure to know your stuff, if not, you will fail.

He is hard to understand, but he teaches straight from the book so no problem there. I think he is a great teacher. He's very nice and helpful. If you have trouble understanding something, he doesn't have a problem spending some extra time helping you grasp the concept. I recommend taking this professor!

Really STRONG ACCENT makes him hard to understand.  Do not take if you learn in lecture because he will leave you behind.  Be ready to teach yourself.  Teaches from the book at least, so just keep up with that.

He can be hard to understand. Teaches right by the book. Learn and read the book if having trouble in class. Very nice. Helpful and willing to answer any questions. HW is always assigned a week before due date. He goes over the HW which takes up the whole class. Quizzes are open book and notes.

He was extremely difficult to understand. He was willing to help but his help was also hard to understand. I know some of the students who were good at math did well, but I came in without prior calculus classes and it was difficult for me. I had to seek help elsewhere. If calc isn't your strong suit, do not take him

I took Dr. Cao for Calc II and it's suppose to be the hardest calculus there is. He helps out so much that you wouldn't think he would be allowed to say certain things during a test. I'm used to asian accents so it didn't bother me but he does have a really heavy accent. But he's willing to help you out alot. I didn't have too much of a problem!!
DON'T TAKE.....He has really strong accent. Sometimes it looks like that he does not know what he is saying. Quizzes and tests are easy, but it is really hard to be in his class.
good teacher; very strong chinese accent that takes a few weeks to become comprehensible; moderately difficult tests and quizzes; whats on them is expected. No suprises
